intro: Lathyrus luteus subsp. tournefortii, commonly known as the yellow vetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands or rocky areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening.
